runs.comm: he almost lets this run between the bat and the pad.. KW was out of the crease and is beaten by the slider, but inside edges to his pads
looks to pull the flatter delivery but that hurries on to him, pushed to midwicket
looks to cut this hard but can't beat short third man
quicker delivery on the stumps, the batsman nudges it to short fine leg for a single
fuller and on off, Neesham can only dig it out to mid-off
shorter and on the stumps, the batsman pushes it softly to long on for a single
it's a full toss and the batsman looks to flick it to the on side but gets a leading edge to third man
back of length delivery, but this is down the leg side and it's helped along the way to the fine leg boundary

another edge, this one is straight to point! Neesham's feet are rooted to the crease and he must be gutted that all he can do to this full toss is get an edge.. Big leading edge that flies straight to point. Cottrell gives the salute.. Neesham experiment not yielding the desired results till now
back of length delivery outside off, Baz cracks it past backward point for a couple of runs
he doesn't care about where the bowler is bowling, just wants to see it fly.. but misses it completely.. That was a wild wild slog from Baz
fuller delivery on the stumps, Baz tucks it to backward square leg for a single
looks to sweep Badree out of the attack immediately, only manages a top edge and he is lucky that it lands safely behind square leg

that is quick work from Ramdin if he has managed that stumping! The batsman marginally shuffles away and gets beaten by this quicker delivery, he misses and the keeper takes the bails off in a flash.. KW was out of the crease when Ramdin takes it, but has slid the back foot in? very difficult to say. Looks like it's going to go in favour of KW. Safe by a whisker
goes down on his knees early and sweeps this one from off stump to pick the gap between short fine leg and backward square leg. Superb placement
shorter and quicker, KW looks to pull it across the line but gets an under edge to short fine leg
much shorter this time, Baz whacks it down to long on
goes across the line and targets the cow-corner boundary, but Russell, from long-on, cuts it off
fires it in the blockhole on off, Baz digs it out to off
he comes out the crease and gets a thick outside edge over the slip cordon for a one-bounce four.. Simmons got a few of these earlier.. Baz wants them back
in the middle .. oh absolutely, as my thesis supervisor used to say! he comes down the pitch and slams it over long off for a huge six
looks to repeat the shot but misses it completely.. This ones flies over the stumps. Punches being exchanged here
oh my my! Baz gets another thick outside edge and there is no one at slip.. Ramdin could have gone for it, but he was moving to the leg side, along with the line of the ball..
length ball, this time he manages to slice it properly to third man
flatter and on the stumps, pushed back to the bowler
big turn, the batsman is not able to get it away..
it goes the other way, Baz pushes it to point for a quick single
big offspin now, the batsman misses his flick
this goes the other way and KW almost chops it on. Sammy, at first slip, dives to stop the runs
loses his line, bowls it on leg stump.. KW goes down on his knees and spoils the over with a swat to fine leg
tossed up and slower, the batsman pushes forward and defends
shorter but what have you done Baz! He gets all the power that he wanted behind that, but he hits it straight to the cover fielder.. What a waste!
beats him immediately as Taylor pushes inside the line of this one
the slider now, the batsman is not shy of defending, pushes it back to the bowler
another one defended to cover. Taylor doesn't know much about the spin on these ones
and it's a wicket-maiden now as Taylor defends again
gets some bounce from length, the batsman dabs it to square leg for a single
back of length on off, the batsman pushes it straight to mid-off
he pushes this softly to cover point for a quick single..
goes down on his knee early to paddle this fine, but only manages to parry it to deep backward square leg
shortish delivery, Taylor plays a controlled pull to deep midwicket, along the ground
looks to make room, he chops it to short third man and asked by the non-striker to come for a single. It's Taylor who is in trouble as the stumps are taken down, but he has just made it in in time
he comes out of the crease, pushes it softly to deep midwicket for a couple of runs
comes down the pitch again, but defends it towards cover
comes down the pitch again and chips it beautifully, goes straight on and beats the man at long off
sweeps this one fine to pick up another easy single
he stays on the back foot and pushes it to deep cover for a single
low full toss, leading edge, we have seen enough of these today, KW is safe though as this is in the gap at cover
slower delivery, KW spots it early and drives it over the extra cover fielder to pick the gap, four more
slower delivery again, but it's not full enough, he chops it to short third man for a single
short and wide, Taylor is a touch too slow in his cut shot, gets beaten
shuffles across the crease, gets a full delivery outside off and drives it crisply through extra cover, but is not able to find the boundary
looks to slog this from outside off but misses, gets an inside edge actually, it ricochets off Ramdin's pads to the leg side
starts off with a low full toss on off, the batsman pushes it straight to midwicket
length delivery outside off, the batsman steers it to third man for a single
fuller and wider outside off, easy come easy go for Taylor, he slices it calmly over point for a boundary
back of length and straight on the stumps, the batsman defends it back down the pitch
fuller and wider outside off, now they have protection at deep point and it's only a single
short of length delivery outside off, KW latches on to it and whacks it over midwicket for a much-needed boundary
this is the doosra, but it;s too full, easily dealt with as Taylor pushes it to long on
this one is short and wide, KW punches it to deep cover for another easy single
doosra again, the batsman cuts it to the right of short third man for another easy run
he stays deep in the crease and tucks the other one to midwicket for a single
some more turn for Narine in his doosras, Taylor chops it on to point
flatter and turning down the leg side, Taylor misses as he was moving across, but this is called a wide
on the pads again, this is flicked very fine on the leg side for a couple
he starts off with an offcutter, KW looks to cut it but misses

this one has gone through! Big offcutter that darts in sharply into the batsman, surprises Williamson, it hits the thigh pad and drops on to his stumps. Pollard sets off on a celebratory run, keeping his finger firmly on his lips.. Big breakthrough
gets a full and wide delivery, this is easier for him, driven to deep extra cover for a single
fuller delivery on off, Taylor whips it to deep midwicket for a single
digs it in short, and it gets stuck on the surface a bit. Anderson is surprised by the bounce, pull his bat in
quicker and angled across, Anderson lets it go through
full and spinning away, the batsman dabs it to backward point off the back foot
looks to play a premeditated sweep, picks it up from outside off and manages to paddle it very fine

that has castled him! Taylor has been shuffling to the off side to deal with the turn - in and out, but he had no answers to this ripper.. Flat and quick outside off, it changes direction on pitching and sneaks through the defences to knock back the off stump..it actually takes the glove on its way
big doosra, the batsman comes forward and leaves it alone
doosra from the middle stump line, Ronchi defends it solidly
quickish offspinner, Ronchi can only defend it to the leg side
bowls a slower delivery that flirts with the wide marker, the umpire calls it.. Polly, not surprisingly, thinks it's harsh
this one is short, but this one stops on the surface. Anderson wanted to pull but the ball arrives very late
looks to charge out but these balls are flying past the edge.. and it's not the pace, it's the lack of it that is causing problems
looks to swing this down the ground but he is not in the line of the ball, misses again
finally gets some bat on it, a healthy top edge as he looks to slog over long on, but it lands well short of Badree at long on.. Pollard is not happy at all.. he wanted the fielder to charge in
length delivery, pushed down the ground to long on for a single
back of length delivery on off, the batsman hops on his toes and nudges it through point for a single
bowls it short outside off from round the wicket, easily pulled down to deep square leg for a single
fuller delivery on the stumps, he punches it in the air, past the non-striker for a single to long on
fired in on the pads and Anderson, missing his slog, gets an inside edge to the leg side
length delivery, whipped off the hips to the deep square leg boundary, the fielder keeps them to two
wider outside off, Ronchi misses out as he makes no contact
bowls a good one on the blockhole but Ronchi manages to clip it fine on the leg side for a couple
finally gets the ball he has been waiting for, a full lolly pop outside the off, Anderson just swings it out of its presence, massive hit over long on
back to hits and misses, this shorter delivery bounces like a tennis ball and beats the bat swing
shorter and outside off, the batsman looks to pull it down the ground, but gets a toe-end to cover point for a single
slower and wider, Ronchi wanted to send this to mars but meets thin air
that field setting didn't really matter here as Ronchi powers this short ball with a murderous hit over midwicket
fuller delivery on the leg stump line, Ronchi misses his flick but picks up a leg bye to square leg
fuller and Ronchi books a ticket to the pavilion! He looks for the big hit but doesn't get the timing, slicing it long off where Russell is present
shorter and quicker on off, the batsman nudges it to point for a single
gets a really short delivery but all Watling can do is pull it to deep midwicket, without any timing
shorter one, comes too quickly, Anderson pulls it to wide long on, says no to the second the moment he sees Russell charging in

this could be a wicket! Anderson said NO the moment Watling set off with this dab to cover, Sammy doesn't waste time and fires an underarm flick.. Watling dives but it's to no avail as Ramdin takes off the bails.. He is well out here.. So Watling was impatient.. only to his detriment though
quicker and shorter on off, cut straight to short third man

superb catch! Sammy, the rubber man, is too good in the outfield.. Anderson drives it towards the long-on boundary, but Sammy covers a lot of ground to his right and dives to complete the catch.. he makes it look simple
these singles to third-man are hardly going to make a dent..
slower delivery on the stumps, Southee drives it to long off
fires in a slower delivery wide outside off, Latham's technique that helped him score those fifties in the Test will not work.. he slogs and misses
goes across the line but finds the man at midwicket
another wicket for Cottrell, another chance to salute everyone! this was a yorker wide outside off and Latham has steered it straight into Bravo's hand at backward point..Bravo Lieutenant Cottrell!
fires in a yorker that Southee digs out to long on
slower delivery, Boult moves well down the leg side and misses it completely
full and wide outside off, Boult slices it over backward point for a couple
short and wide, Boult cuts it over point this time for another couple
fuller delivery, the batsman drives it to deep point for a single
walks way over to the off side, laps it up but can only give Cottrell another chance to salute.. He takes a simple catch at short fine leg
this is a direct hit from point! Darren Bravo may have sealed the win as he takes down the stumps at the non-striker's end.. West Indies draw the series with an emphatic win here in Dominica
